name: quaver
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a person's voice quavers, it shakes, usually because of emotion: Her voice began to quaver and I thought she was going to cry.

(MUSICAL NOTE)
[ C ]
  music
  UK specialized (US eighth note) a musical note that is half as long as a crotchet

quaver noun
(SHAKE)
[ S ] a slight shake in someone's voice, especially because of emotion: There was a quaver in her voice as she thanked her staff for all their support.

Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a person’s voice) to sound nervous, esp. because of emotion: Her voice quavered for a moment before she gained control.
